_header: For love of Jesu my sweet heart
_description: A couplet in a Latin homily, Amore Langueo (and repeated passim)

CULKk424.Transcription:
ffor loue of ihesu þat ys myn hertey morne & syke wyt terys
                    smert
CULKk424.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Preachers, Poets and the English Lyric.
         Princeton: Princeton Univ. Press, 1986: 237-8.

OxfBal149.Transcription:
For loue of Iesu my swete hertey morne & seke wyþ teres
                    smert
OxfBal149.Note: Written as prose in a Latin sermon on Easter.
OxfBal149.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.131.

OxfMagd93.Transcription:
for the loue of ihesu that is myn herty morne y syke with teres
                    smert
OxfMagd93.Note:
Written as prose, second occurrence in ‘Amore
                    Langueo’.

TCD277.Transcription:
for luf of ihesu my swete hertI morn & sygh with terys
                    smert
